channel.title: How to print result of query execution in alerts, not only name of alert
channel.description: I created alerts, it execute query and return in string ids which have such condition, i want that in email or whatever everyone can see the result of this query execution without click on query. Cause people who has not permissions need to get this result but has not , and they must not have permissions to look at code of query and change this or have redash

item.title: How to print result of query execution in alerts, not only name of alert
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
Also requested here:

More Customizable Slack Notifications Feature Requests
Awesome, thanks - I’ll have a play around with that, and then keep an eye out for #3137

item.title: How to print result of query execution in alerts, not only name of alert
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
This is a feature that has been requested before (see below) and will be implemented as part of V9.

Customize Alert Body Feature Requests
Currently the body of an alert is hard-coded per destination. E.g. in email notifications, every alert says Check <a href="{host}/alerts/{alert_id}">alert</a> / check <a href="{host}/queries/{query_id}">query</a>. and in Slack notifications, every alert says alert.name + " just triggered". This is fine if you just want to know something happened, but it would be nice to also get details on why or how it happened, or what to do about it. I propose to do this by adding an optional “Alert Body” fie…

Read full topic
